title: Boxly Design Pattern
text: boxly package developed generate interactive box plot safety analysis clinical trials. generate interactive box plot, develop two main functions listed . details two main functions introduced next sections separately. prepare_boxly(): Obtain information lab vital sign ready visualization. boxly(): Generate interactive box plot. minimal example summarizing major steps using forestly package
code: outdata <- prepare_boxly(...)    # Step 1: create a list object include data required for plotting boxly(outdata)                   # Step 2: generate interactive box plot

title: Boxly Design Pattern
text: interactive visualization tool, boxly contains several interactive features: Hover label outlier show participant ID, change baseline value baseline value. Hover label box number subject summary statistics number participant, minimum, Q1, mean, median, Q3, maximum, standard deviation. Select box select parameter (Need POC) Slider bar control cut value number subject (Need POC) Append summary table box plot

title: Boxly Design Pattern
text: Metadata generated metalite package required input. meta_boxly() generated boxly package illustration purpose. Users create metadata similar structure.
code: library(metalite) library(dplyr) library(plotly) library(htmlwidgets) library(crosstalk) library(boxly) meta <- meta_boxly() meta

title: Boxly Design Pattern
text: main function prepare_boxly() used obtain tidy data visualization. output function list object contains meta data information, variable names used plotting x, y, group parameter variable data frame plotting. x, y, group parameter variable four main variables required generate interactive box plot. variable names extracted input meta data using metalite::collect_adam_mapping(). x, group parameter variable factor data type. y variable numeric data type. check data type variables convert data type need prepare_boxly(). x, y, group parameter variable name saved returned list prepare_boxly() element x_var, y_var, group_var param_var accordingly. Also, plotting dataset generated function. plotting dataset includes statistical variables count, quantile, mean, median, min, max, standard deviation outlier value calculated function. (stand deviation part developed currently) variables used hover label participant ID baseline variable also include. (Baseline variable included now) structure expected output list prepare_boxly(): example plotting dataset contained output list:
code: outdata <- prepare_boxly(meta,   population = "apat",   observation = "wk12",   parameter = "sodium;bili;urate",   analysis = "lb_boxly" ) outdata head(outdata$plotds)

title: Boxly Design Pattern
text: function generates interactive box plot returned object prepare_boxly(). interactive box plot, consists two blocks. first block select list slider bar. Items listed select list specified unique value parameter variable contained returned object prepare_boxly(). clicking different parameter label, different interactive boxplot display. example, click “Alkaline Phosphatase (U/L)”, reactable display interactive box plot Alkaline Phosphatase (U/L). main tool develop block crosstalk::filter_select(). slider bar, control cut number byy slide slider bar. example, participant number treatment group time point larger 5 box shown. main tool develop block crosstalk::filter_slider(). (part development) second block combined interactive visualization tool contains box plot display interactive table appended number participant. box plot mainly developed plotly package table developed using DT package. generate static scatter plot outliers specifically ggplot2 convert interactive plot using plotly::ggplotly(). add box plot layer invisible bar plot layer using plotly::add_trace(). reason need create outlier box separately plotly support different hover label box outlier. Appended table generated using DT::datatable(). htmltools::div() used combine two components now. Hover label display properly part mentioned Interactive Feature part . Argument list minimum viable production. layout labels just illustration now.
code: p_list <- prepare_boxly(meta,   population = "apat",   observation = "wk12",   parameter = "sodium;bili;urate",   analysis = "lb_boxly" ) %>%   boxly() p_list

title: Boxly Design Pattern
text: Refine plot layout column label. Add select list slider bar. Fulfill requirements hover label format calculated statistical value. Bug: outliers display well. seems issue ggplot2 geom_point() generate different display aes(..., text = ) aes(...) scenario.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Benjamin Wang. Author, maintainer. Yujie Zhao. Author. Sarad Nepal. Contributor. Madhusudhan Ginnaram. Contributor. Merck Sharp & Dohme Corp. Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wang B, Zhao Y (2023). boxly: Interactive Box Plot. https://merck.github.io/boxly/, https://github.com/Merck/boxly.
code: @Manual{,   title = {boxly: Interactive Box Plot},   author = {Benjamin Wang and Yujie Zhao},   year = {2023},   note = {https://merck.github.io/boxly/, https://github.com/Merck/boxly}, }

title: Interactive Box Plot
text: aim boxly create interactive box plot analysis & reporting using R.

title: Interactive Box Plot
text: general workflow covers: Step 1: construct input metadata treatment analysis ADaM datasets. Step 2: prepare datasets interactive box plot prepare_boxly(). Step 3: generate interactive box plot using boxly().

title: Interactive Box Plot
text: Parameters can selected. example, laboratory (LB) analysis, () Sodium, (ii) Billirubin, (iii) Urate. Different labels can revealed hovering box outlier. Count table can appended interactive box plot.

what: Create an interactive box plot — boxly
title: Create an interactive box plot — boxly
text: Create interactive box plot

title: Create an interactive box plot — boxly
code: boxly(   outdata,   color = NULL,   hover_summary_var = c("n", "min", "q1", "median", "mean", "q3", "max"),   hover_outlier_label = c("Participant Id", "Parameter value"),   x_label = "Visit",   y_label = "Change",   heading_select_list = "Lab parameter",   heading_summary_table = "Number of Participants" )

title: Create an interactive box plot — boxly
text: outdata outdata object created prepare_ae_forestly(). color Color box plot. hover_summary_var character vector statistics displayed hover label box. hover_outlier_label character vector hover label outlier. x_label x-axis label. y_label y-axis label. heading_select_list Select list menu label. heading_summary_table Summary table label.

title: Create an interactive box plot — boxly
text: Interactive box plot.

title: Create an interactive box plot — boxly
code: # Only run this example in interactive R sessions if (interactive()) {   library(metalite)    meta_boxly() |>     prepare_boxly(       population = "apat",       observation = "wk12",       analysis = "lb_boxly",       parameter = "sodium;bili;urate"     ) |>     boxly() }

what: Create an example metadata object — meta_boxly
title: Create an example metadata object — meta_boxly
text: Create example metadata object

title: Create an example metadata object — meta_boxly
Create an example metadata object — meta_boxly
text: Metadata creating interactive box plot.

title: Create an example metadata object — meta_boxly
code: meta_boxly() #> ADaM metadata:  #>    .$data_population 	Population data with 254 subjects  #>    .$data_observation 	Observation data with 24746 records  #>    .$plan 	Analysis plan with 2 plans  #>  #>  #>   Analysis population type: #>     name        id  group var       subset                         label #> 1 'apat' 'USUBJID' 'TRTA'     SAFFL == 'Y' 'All Participants as Treated' #>  #>  #>   Analysis observation type: #>     name        id  group     var #> 1 'wk12' 'USUBJID' 'TRTA' 'PARAM' #> 2 'wk24' 'USUBJID' 'TRTA' 'PARAM' #>                                                        subset            label #> 1                ANL01FL == 'Y' & AVISITN <= 12 & !is.na(CHG)  'Weeks 0 to 12' #> 2 ANL01FL == 'Y' & AVISITN > 12 & AVISITN <= 24 & !is.na(CHG) 'Weeks 12 to 24' #>  #>  #>   Analysis parameter type: #>       name                label              subset #> 1 'sodium'    'Sodium (mmol/L)' PARAMCD == 'SODIUM' #> 2   'bili' 'Bilirubin (umol/L)'   PARAMCD == 'BILI' #> 3  'urate'     'Urate (umol/L)'  PARAMCD == 'URATE' #>  #>  #>   Analysis function: #>         name                                          label #> 1 'lb_boxly' 'Interactive: box plot for laboratory results' #>

what: Prepare data for interactive box plot — prepare_boxly
title: Prepare data for interactive box plot — prepare_boxly
text: Prepare data interactive box plot

title: Prepare data for interactive box plot — prepare_boxly
Prepare data for interactive box plot — prepare_boxly
text: meta metadata object created metalite. population character value population term name. term name used key link information. observation character value observation term name. term name used key link information. analysis Name analysis plan. parameter character value parameter term name. term name used key link information.

title: Prepare data for interactive box plot — prepare_boxly
text: Metadata list plotting dataset.

title: Prepare data for interactive box plot — prepare_boxly
code: library(metalite) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  meta <- meta_boxly() prepare_boxly(   meta,   population = "apat",   observation = "wk12",   analysis = "lb_boxly",   parameter = "sodium;bili;urate" ) #> Warning: In observation level data, the facet variable 'PARAM' is automatically transformed into a factor! #> Warning: In observation level data, the group variable 'AVISITN' is automatically transformed into a factor! #> Joining with `by = join_by(TRTA, PARAM, AVISITN)` #> List of 13 #>  $ meta           :List of 7 #>  $ population     : chr "apat" #>  $ observation    : chr "wk12" #>  $ parameter      : chr "sodium;bili;urate" #>  $ n              :'data.frame':	45 obs. of  4 variables: #>  $ order          : NULL #>  $ group          : NULL #>  $ reference_group: NULL #>  $ x_var          : chr "AVISITN" #>  $ y_var          : chr "CHG" #>  $ group_var      : chr "TRTA" #>  $ param_var      : chr "PARAM" #>  $ plotds         : tibble [625 × 15] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame)
